Published

January 16, 2023

Content

  • Human perception and information processing
  • Perceptual and design principles for effective visual analytics
  • Principles of Graphic Design
    • Rules for Encoding Values in Graph
    • JunkCharts
    • Practical Guides for Using Colour in Charts
    • Data-ink

  • Clarity or Aesthetics? Part 3 – Tips for Achieving Both

Visual Analytics Method(s) of the Week

Boxplot

  • Understanding Boxplots
  • Regina L. Nuzzo (2016) “The Box Plots Alternative for Visualizing Quantitative Data”, PR&M, Volume8, Issue3, pp. 268-272.

Violin Plots

  • Violin Plot-wikipedia
  • Hintze, Jerry L.; Nelson, Ray D. (1998). “Violin Plots: A Box Plot-Density Trace Synergism”. The American Statistician. 52 (2): 181–4
  • Violin Plot by LondonSODA.

Notched Box Plots

  • Notched Box Plots

Dot Plots

  • Dot plots
  • Dot Plots: A Useful Alternative to Bar Charts
  • The dot plot: A graphical tool for data analysis and presentation
  • Leland Wilkinson (1999) “Dot Plot”, Statistical Computing and Graphics, Vol. 53, No. 3, pp. 276-281.

Pie chart and Bar chart

  • Understanding Pie Charts
  • Tracey L. Weissgerber et. al. (2015) “Beyond Bar and Line Graphs: Time for a New Data Presentation Paradigm”, PLoS Biology.

Raincloud Plots

  • Allen M, Poggiali D, Whitaker K et al. “Raincloud plots: a multi-platform tool for robust data. visualization” [version 2; peer review: 2 approved]. Welcome Open Res 2021, pp. 4:63.

Diverging Stacked Bar Chart

  • Design of Diverging Stacked Bar Charts for Likert Scales and Other Applications
  • When Are 100% Stacked Bar Graphs Useful?
  • The case against diverging stacked bars
  • Are diverging 100% stacked bars useless?
  • Rethinking the divergent stacked bar chart — placing the stronger views in the center

Packed Bars

  • Introducing packed bars, a new chart form
  • rPackedBar: Packed Bar Charts with ‘plotly’
